com.informatics.lehigh.cardboardarlibrary

Interface GLRenderer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CameraTextureRenderer, StereoScreenRenderer

    public interface GLRenderer
    Basic interface describing a class that sets up, updates, and executes rendering of an object for the Google Cardboard using OpenGL. Classes that implement this interface are usually called on by activities that implement GvrView.StereoRenderer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(float[] view, float[] perspective)
      Draws the GL elements defined by this renderer.
      void init()
      Initialize all GL elements of the renderer like buffers, textures, and shaders.
      void update(com.google.vr.sdk.base.HeadTransform headTransform)
      Updates the GL elements of the renderer like vertex buffers and model matrices.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
        Initialize all GL elements of the renderer like buffers, textures, and shaders. Should be called from onSurfaceCreated().

      • update

        void update(com.google.vr.sdk.base.HeadTransform headTransform)
        Updates the GL elements of the renderer like vertex buffers and model matrices. These things are independent of any single view and is meant to be called once per frame. Should be called from onNewFrame().
        Parameters:
        headTransform - Contains the up, right, and forward vectors of the cardboard viewer needed for calculations.

      • draw

        void draw(float[] view,
          float[] perspective)
        Draws the GL elements defined by this renderer. This should be called from onDrawEye().
        Parameters:
        view - The 4x4 view matrix to use for rendering.
        perspective - The 4x4 projection matrix to user for rendering.
